column4: yeah sounds like a script conflict maybe there is a version variation
hmm beer
someone told me there was a fus over images used with ubuntu being pornographic.. I looked for ages and didnt find anything on my image...now Im like "Ive been ripped off" were my pr0n images lol
what porn images I didnt find any...and if those or pr0n sheesh you guys should see more billboards
are*
the discussion is basically over, because we made the images no longer default
sounds like the americans have invaded
not really, only a fraction of the negative opinions were from Americans.
yeah but your not going to have apache mysql and php and a few mail server options squished into that single CD
sure, but that's ok, you can get them from the network totally trivially. people installing servers will be picking their own package sets anyway.
I can do that with Novell too but II dont get the Enterprise server rig for that reason i get it because everything on the CD works together very well
I dont want a desktop Ive already done that....now I want a dedicated server solution
I wasn't contradicting that in the slightest
as soon as the customer install either red hat or Novell guess whats happens........both of those companies will throw in a 12 month desktop install for free....bye bye Ubuntu
our releases are all supported for 18 months and we'll be doing longer-term support options too.
you can do that with any distro.....you miss the logic of having a distro
as a distribution developer, I respectfully disagree :-)
using your logic I may aswell go grab Debian because im getting the same thing anyway
you don't get security support over three release cycles with Debian
you mean lazy as in "doesnt chew up time"
like it or not customers want to install stuff not on the CD, so any sane distro will integrate that stuff too
yes but I dont want to work around a "desktop" CD to install a server....i want a server CD for servers
